printCpu

private void printCpu(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,CpuData> mapActualCpu,
                      int _interval)
The following operations are executed for each core of the processor and for the virtual core number 0, which is the sum of all CPU cores times. Subtracts the total CPU times from the current monitored CPU data object from the previously one. Then, subtracts the idle time from the current monitored CPU data object from the previously one. After calculate both differences, calculate the usage for the core by subtracting the idle time from the total time and dividing by the total time.

calculateCpuUsage

private java.lang.String calculateCpuUsage(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,CpuData> mapActualCpu,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,CpuData> mapPreviouslyCpu,
                                           int core)
Parameters:
mapActualCpu - : The collection with the least gathered Cpu monitored data
mapPreviouslyCpu - : The collection with the immediately previously gathered Cpu monitored data
core - : the number of the core. A "0" value means that is sum off all cores
Returns:
the usage tax value

calculateCpuUsageTax

private long calculateCpuUsageTax(long totalDiff,
                                  long idleDiff)
Parameters:
totalDiff - : The total (sum of all CPU times) difference time between the two CPU clock measures
idleDiff - : The total idle difference time between the two CPU clock measures
Returns:
the usage tax

getMonitoredDataObjectForInterval

private MonitoredData getMonitoredDataObjectForInterval(int interval)
To analyze some component during a specific time interval, we must compare the current monitored data object to the one collected the interval seconds before. This method returns the monitored data object gathered interval seconds before.
